title: John Kennedy (Louisiana politician)
added: On July 29, 2021 President Joe Biden signed Kennedy's DUMP Opioids Act into law, making that Kennedy's eighth piece of legislation to become law in his first term as a U.S. Senator. <ref>{{cite news |title=Congress.gov advanced search|url= https://www.congress.gov/quick-search/legislation?wordsPhrases=&wordVariants=on&congresses%5B%5D=all&legislationNumbers=&legislativeAction=&sponsor=on&representative=&senator=K000393&q=%7B%22bill-status%22%3A%22law%22%7D|access-date=9 September 2021 |work=Congress.gov |date=27 July 2021 |language=en}}</ref> Kennedy has authored more bills signed into law than any first-term senator from Louisiana, save Sen. Newton Blanchard, who is tied with Kennedy. <ref>{{cite news |title=Even with cornpone jokes, John N. Kennedy leverages his position for state|url=https://www.theadvocate.com/baton_rouge/opinion/article_cc0f6da6-099b-11ec-bbf2-b71c32ff6b72.html|access-date=9 September 2021 |work=The Advocate |date=1 September 2021 |language=en}}</ref>

title: John Kennedy (Louisiana politician)
added: In March 2019, Kennedy introduced the Holding Foreign Companies Accountable Act, which became law on December 18, 2020. <ref>{{cite news |title=S.945 - Holding Foreign Companies Accountable Act |url=

The law requires certain issuers of securities to establish that they are not owned or controlled by a foreign government, including China. Specifically, an issuer must make this certification if the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board is unable to audit specified reports because the issuer has retained a foreign public accounting firm not subject to inspection by the board. Furthermore, if the board is unable to inspect the issuer's public accounting firm for three consecutive years, the issuer's securities are banned from trade on a national exchange or through other methods. <ref>{{cite news |title=S.945 - Holding Foreign Companies Accountable Act |url=https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/senate-bill/945?r=3&s=2|work=Congress.gov |date=18 December 2020 |language=en}}</ref>
